ETYMOLOGY: Combination of the common Old English words 'some' (sum) and 'time' (tīma).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A considerable or relatively long period of time.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 相当长的一段时间；很久。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It has been some time since we last visited the coast.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们上次去海岸边已经是很久以前的事了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An unspecified period of time or duration.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一段未具体说明的时长。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I need some time to think about your proposal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我需要一些时间来考虑你的提议。
